messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: Investigator Lewis, with the assistance of Chauffer Rodney Robinson, rolled the dec3dent over and placed her in a b0dy bag. When the decedent was m0ved, 1nvestigators observed a single spent casing in the pool of bl00d where the decedent had been laying. Technician Muhammad photographed and collected the spent casing, identified as a 'Win' 9mm Luger, at 12:31am. Sergeant McMullen advised Detective Morton that there was a blood trail from the interior hallway where the vict1m was located to North Derbignay Street. Detective Morton observed the crime scene and noted the details on the H-10983-09 PAGE 16. At 2:30AM, Crime Lab Technician Tamika Rogers conducted gunshot residue tests on both Darceleen Commodore and Earlitta Taylor at the Homicide Office. The Coroner's Office Day Records, from Detective David Trehan, officially classified the shooting deaths of Patrice Commodore and Jessie Bibbins as Homicides. Detective Aucoin, after investigating the scene, secured the residence, placing a seal from the Orleans Parish Coroner's Office on the door. Detective Pratt of the Homicide Section handled another scene on Mazant Street. Detective Sergeant Chris Robert, along with officers from units including Officer Juan Lopez, Officers Phil Burras & Quincy Broaden, Officers Nate Addison & Glen Hewitt, and Detective Gregory Johnson, were involved in various capacities. Detectives Jason McGee and Ananie Mitchell, as well as Detective Melvin McCullum, also played roles in the investigation. Officer Gary Sallienger of the Scientific Criminal Investigations Division was responsible for sketching part of the crime scene. Coroner's Office Investigator Parnell Williams processed a related scene. Detectives Morton and Orlando Mathews interviewed witnesses and compiled photographic line-ups for identification purposes.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Investigator LewisOfficer Context: Assisted by Chauffer Rodney Robinson, rolled the decedent over and placed her in a body bag.Officer Role: InvestigatorOfficer Name: Technician MuhammadOfficer Context: Photographed and collected the spent casing identified as a 'Win' 9mm Luger at the crime scene.Officer Role: TechnicianOfficer Name: Sergeant McMullenOfficer Context: Advised Detective Morton of a blood trail leading from the crime scene to North Derbignay Street.Officer Role: SergeantOfficer Name: Detective MortonOfficer Context: Noted details of the crime scene on H-10983-09 PAGE 16 and was involved in various aspects of the investigation, including interviewing witnesses.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Crime Lab Technician Tamika RogersOfficer Context: Conducted gunshot residue tests on Darceleen Commodore and Earlitta Taylor at the Homicide Office.Officer Role: Crime Lab TechnicianOfficer Name: Detective David TrehanOfficer Context: Provided the Coroner's Office Day Records that classified two shooting deaths as homicides.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective AucoinOfficer Context: Investigated the scene, secured the residence, and placed a seal from the Orleans Parish Coroner's Office on the door.Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Detective PrattOfficer Context: Handled a crime scene on Mazant Street.Officer Role:
